name: Lifebooker.com
overview:
Lifebooker.com is an online marketplace where clients can book discounted health and beauty appointments with Manhattanâ€™s premier establishments.

Lifebooker.com offers city dwellers the opportunity to search, find, and book services based on discount, location, establishment name, and time. This marketplace is beneficial to the spas and salons who advertise on Lifebooker it serves as an alternative to traditional advertising, offering its partner businesses a pay-per-performance marketing tool.

“We allow any businesses with an Internet connection to discount certain hours over others. These appointments are then advertised in real time, browsed through, and booked instantly online. Consumers find uniquely good deals, and businesses fill unused appointment times. The service is free for consumers, Pay-For-Performance for businesses, and ultimately a win-win for everyone,”

– COO Dana Reichman.

“It’s free until I get an appointment, and when I do, the cost is still so much less than doing my own advertising,”

– Jamie Ahn, owner of, Townhouse Spa & Acqua Beauty Bar.

“We’ve created a more efficient marketplace benefiting all involved parties. We save time and money for consumers, while allowing businesses to turn wasting assets into a new revenue stream. Our core value propositions are especially compelling considering the current economic climate. We’ve often seen Lifebooker help both smaller shops and new businesses, who can’t afford to gamble on traditional marketing efforts, keep their doors open and even thrive during this downturn.”

– Andrew Unger

funding_rounds.source_description: Lifebooker Receives $4M Investment from Edison Ventures

external_links.title: Lifebooker finds & books discount spa treatments
